I worked as a manager at a retail store, and the biggest issue came about due to the locking mechanism. A customer was running with his shopping cart while his daughter was in it. He was "just having fun" with his daughter. So he began doing that thing where you push the cart really hard forward away from you, run towards it, and push again. He did that over the yellow line. So as she crossed the yellow line, with him far behind her, the front wheel locked and the whole cart flipped forward, with his daughter inside. 

The yellow line was just repainted, so the guy knew it was there, plus, the shopping carts all have a sign warning of the locking mechanism.

Now, I completely agree the guy is an idiot. Or he deliberately did it... I have seen on camera, parents pushing their kids into a shelf and try to blame the store and get $ out of it. Iv'e seen many things in retail.

But, I still think that there should be an improvement to prevent something like this to happen. Even if it rare.
